description: Word 2016 Expert for Mac takes users to the next level in document processing.  This series explores how to enhance long documents with episodes that include: creating a table of contents, generating an index, adding footnotes and endnotes, inserting bookmarks and cross references, labeling figures with captions, and citing references for a bibliography. Also covered in long documents is how to create a master document and add sub documents for large projects. Other topics in this series include how to collaborate in Word and through Office 365 online, secure your documents, and add or edit document properties. While Word 2016 Expert for Mac is a continuation from the Word 2016 Advanced and Essentials for Mac series, episodes can be viewed individually for specific topics or enjoyed in sequence.
descriptionMD: Word 2016 Expert for Mac takes users to the next level in document processing.  This series explores how to enhance long documents with episodes that include: creating a table of contents, generating an index, adding footnotes and endnotes, inserting bookmarks and cross references, labeling figures with captions, and citing references for a bibliography. Also covered in long documents is how to create a master document and add sub documents for large projects. Other topics in this series include how to collaborate in Word and through Office 365 online, secure your documents, and add or edit document properties. While Word 2016 Expert for Mac is a continuation from the Word 2016 Advanced and Essentials for Mac series, episodes can be viewed individually for specific topics or enjoyed in sequence.
name: Word 2016 Expert for Mac
subtitle: Document and word processing software

episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:04.620
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:04.620 --> 00:00:11.110
Hello, everyone, my name is Vonne Smith,
and welcome to Word 2016 Expert for Mac.

3
00:00:11.110 --> 00:00:13.630
In this course overview,
we're going to be,

4
00:00:13.630 --> 00:00:16.650
well, what exactly does this course cover?

5
00:00:16.650 --> 00:00:20.400
What and
who is our target audience of people?

6
00:00:20.400 --> 00:00:22.320
Do we need to know anything
before we get started and

7
00:00:22.320 --> 00:00:24.850
any extra tip bits along the way?

8
00:00:24.850 --> 00:00:29.300
So let's talk about what is
in this particular series.

9
00:00:29.300 --> 00:00:31.591
This is all about long documents,

10
00:00:31.591 --> 00:00:36.340
that's going to be where we have our
major concentration of episodes.

11
00:00:36.340 --> 00:00:40.473
Now this is where concentrating on things
that are associated with a long document,

12
00:00:40.473 --> 00:00:42.160
such as a table of contents.

13
00:00:42.160 --> 00:00:45.690
Maybe go ahead in creating an index
of terms that you wanna go ahead and

14
00:00:45.690 --> 00:00:47.970
put in the back of your book.

15
00:00:47.970 --> 00:00:53.199
We'll also be discussing things known
as bookmarks, cross references, we're

16
00:00:53.199 --> 00:00:58.215
going to learn how to insert citations,
and be able to create a bibliography.

17
00:00:58.215 --> 00:01:03.550
A really great thing to know about if you
have to do any type of research papers.

18
00:01:03.550 --> 00:01:08.592
And believe me, back in my day we
didn't have anything like this and

19
00:01:08.592 --> 00:01:12.400
I really wish we did,
makes your life a lot easier.

20
00:01:12.400 --> 00:01:17.025
We'll also going to be discussing how to
create and insert footnotes and end notes,

21
00:01:17.025 --> 00:01:18.890
and how to format them.

22
00:01:18.890 --> 00:01:22.930
We'll also be adding
captions to your images and

23
00:01:22.930 --> 00:01:25.180
or tables or any type of graphics.

24
00:01:25.180 --> 00:01:31.730
And then being able to generate
a table of figures or table of tables.

25
00:01:31.730 --> 00:01:37.800
So really great powerful stuff for
you to be using within a long document.

26
00:01:37.800 --> 00:01:41.580
We'll also get into the topic
of what is a master document and

27
00:01:42.660 --> 00:01:45.560
how to insert or create sub documents.

28
00:01:45.560 --> 00:01:50.920
And how that could be most effective for
you in creating a long

29
00:01:50.920 --> 00:01:55.770
document that maybe needs multiple
parts and multiple contributors.

30
00:01:55.770 --> 00:01:58.660
Along those same lines, we're going to
get into some episodes that deal in

31
00:01:58.660 --> 00:02:01.730
collaborating with other individuals.

32
00:02:01.730 --> 00:02:05.543
My master documents could kind of
fall into that but I went ahead and

33
00:02:05.543 --> 00:02:07.121
put in the long documents.

34
00:02:07.121 --> 00:02:11.626
But the big think with track changes, a
really great powerful way of proofing and

35
00:02:11.626 --> 00:02:15.932
editing and being able to track edits
along the way when you're using Word and

36
00:02:15.932 --> 00:02:18.900
being able to collaborate
with multiple people.

37
00:02:18.900 --> 00:02:23.440
Something I've used extensively
throughout my work within Word and

38
00:02:23.440 --> 00:02:25.580
collaborating with others.

39
00:02:25.580 --> 00:02:29.349
We'll also learn how to compare or
combine documents and

40
00:02:29.349 --> 00:02:32.830
what those particular functions do.

41
00:02:32.830 --> 00:02:36.765
And then we'll also collaborate online
where we're going to put things up

42
00:02:36.765 --> 00:02:40.709
into our OneDrive account that is
part of our Office 365 subscription.

43
00:02:40.709 --> 00:02:45.417
And then being able to share, and
collaborate, and edit in real time,

44
00:02:45.417 --> 00:02:49.968
either using your locally installed
version of Word, or go ahead and

45
00:02:49.968 --> 00:02:53.908
using the online version of
Word which is really powerful.

46
00:02:53.908 --> 00:02:57.362
We'll also get into documents
search security, and

47
00:02:57.362 --> 00:03:03.030
then also document properties, that extra
metadata that's added into documents.

48
00:03:03.030 --> 00:03:06.305
Where to find it, how to edit it,
why it's important, and

49
00:03:06.305 --> 00:03:09.135
why it might be important
to actually take it away.

50
00:03:09.135 --> 00:03:12.239
And then security things
like item passwords and

51
00:03:12.239 --> 00:03:16.325
locking down those documents for
people to either open or edit,

52
00:03:16.325 --> 00:03:19.440
and that way it keeps it
a little bit more secure.

53
00:03:19.440 --> 00:03:24.000
And maybe also talk a bit a little
about just general security practices

54
00:03:24.000 --> 00:03:27.740
outside of Word but
working within a networked environment.

55
00:03:28.990 --> 00:03:30.780
We have an additional topics area.

56
00:03:30.780 --> 00:03:32.708
That's where I'm gonna go ahead and

57
00:03:32.708 --> 00:03:36.387
put in things I customized in
the interface, adding your own Ribbon.

58
00:03:36.387 --> 00:03:39.760
And then also we put in forms in there.

59
00:03:39.760 --> 00:03:43.689
Making forms in Word, is it the best?

60
00:03:43.689 --> 00:03:48.197
I don't know, the jury's still out on
there, but it can be very efficient and

61
00:03:48.197 --> 00:03:51.612
very helpful for you, so
I definitely wanted to go ahead and

62
00:03:51.612 --> 00:03:55.870
make sure that you know you can
make forms in Word for Mac.

63
00:03:55.870 --> 00:03:58.840
So who is this show targeted towards?

64
00:03:58.840 --> 00:04:04.289
Any Office user, so anybody with
a capital O that is, so Office 365.

65
00:04:04.289 --> 00:04:08.481
But this is really where you wanna
get into the nitty gritty with

66
00:04:08.481 --> 00:04:11.260
long document creations.

67
00:04:11.260 --> 00:04:13.990
Not everybody is going to be
using Word in that capability.

68
00:04:13.990 --> 00:04:17.850
But if you are creating these types of
things with table of contents and indices,

69
00:04:17.850 --> 00:04:21.600
this is definitely the series
to go ahead and watch.

70
00:04:21.600 --> 00:04:26.231
So I would say you should have like
an intermediate knowledge of Word.

71
00:04:26.231 --> 00:04:30.658
So you've been using this product for
a little bit, you feel really comfortable

72
00:04:30.658 --> 00:04:34.905
with the foundations and you just wanna
go ahead and up that to the next level.

73
00:04:34.905 --> 00:04:37.440
So that being said,
what do you need to know about this?

74
00:04:37.440 --> 00:04:41.010
And intermediate knowledge of Word,
you need to be very comfortable,

75
00:04:41.010 --> 00:04:44.060
or at least decently
comfortable with styles.

76
00:04:44.060 --> 00:04:48.911
A lot of the things that we're going
to be talking about in this particular

77
00:04:48.911 --> 00:04:50.645
series deal with styles.

78
00:04:50.645 --> 00:04:53.205
And then of course page
layout which is really,

79
00:04:53.205 --> 00:04:56.982
kind of going in with the sections and
understanding what that means,

80
00:04:56.982 --> 00:05:01.280
page breaks, continuous section breaks,
next page section breaks.

81
00:05:01.280 --> 00:05:05.020
All of these are things that we
have covered in our other series.

82
00:05:05.020 --> 00:05:10.150
The Word essentials and Word advance,
so be familiar with all of that.

83
00:05:10.150 --> 00:05:14.448
I always put in that other Office
products will help if you have some

84
00:05:14.448 --> 00:05:16.071
familiarity with them.

85
00:05:16.071 --> 00:05:20.676
It's not essential to know any of
that within this particular level but

86
00:05:20.676 --> 00:05:25.129
again, if you're doing a Word Expert
you're probably going to have

87
00:05:25.129 --> 00:05:29.140
a little bit more exposure to
multiple Office applications.

88
00:05:29.140 --> 00:05:34.350
And knowing something in one always
helps a little bit in some others.

89
00:05:34.350 --> 00:05:38.140
There are exercise files that
are associated with each episode

90
00:05:38.140 --> 00:05:42.740
in this whole series, so you are able to
download them and be able to use them.

91
00:05:42.740 --> 00:05:45.172
They are available in its entirety for

92
00:05:45.172 --> 00:05:49.432
all of the episodes with their file
names in this course overview.

93
00:05:49.432 --> 00:05:51.910
So you're more than welcome to
download them all from here.

94
00:05:51.910 --> 00:05:56.483
And if anything's awry, maybe it's
the wrong file, or it doesn't have

95
00:05:56.483 --> 00:06:01.274
the right corrections in it, let us know,
contact us, and I wanna make sure I

96
00:06:01.274 --> 00:06:05.969
have the correct file up there so you
are able to follow along if you want to.

97
00:06:05.969 --> 00:06:09.050
And as always,
Word has about 15 ways to do things,

98
00:06:09.050 --> 00:06:12.755
there's always gonna be other ways,
I might not mention them.

99
00:06:12.755 --> 00:06:15.943
So it's not that I left
that out on purpose, but

100
00:06:15.943 --> 00:06:20.587
it's just always there's many,
many different ways to do things.

101
00:06:20.587 --> 00:06:24.071
Updates [SOUND], man,
Office updates can really throw you for

102
00:06:24.071 --> 00:06:26.930
a loop where everything goes ahead and
changes.

103
00:06:26.930 --> 00:06:29.680
So if your version of Word
looks a little bit different or

104
00:06:29.680 --> 00:06:32.860
there's some different
functionalities than the one that

105
00:06:32.860 --> 00:06:36.710
am using at this current time
of recording, it happens.

106
00:06:36.710 --> 00:06:41.629
You can always check for your updates,
you can run your Office updates to

107
00:06:41.629 --> 00:06:45.913
see if you need to be, or
can get to the next level of the Office.

108
00:06:45.913 --> 00:06:50.054
Those incremental updates with
Office 365 are always happening,

109
00:06:50.054 --> 00:06:52.615
and sometimes can mess
you up a little bit.

110
00:06:52.615 --> 00:06:54.082
[LAUGH] It's happened to me.

111
00:06:54.082 --> 00:06:57.562
There's tons of answers out there online,
so doing Google searches or

112
00:06:57.562 --> 00:07:01.270
whatever search engine of your
choosing is really, really helpful.

113
00:07:01.270 --> 00:07:05.850
I like to give you links within the show
notes for the ones that I refer to but

114
00:07:05.850 --> 00:07:06.990
there's always more.

115
00:07:08.000 --> 00:07:10.791
And everybody has different
reasons of why they use Word.

116
00:07:10.791 --> 00:07:14.821
So maybe some of these episodes are not
necessarily things that you need to

117
00:07:14.821 --> 00:07:15.740
know about.

118
00:07:15.740 --> 00:07:18.953
Maybe you're not writing research papers,
so you don't need a bibliography.

119
00:07:18.953 --> 00:07:22.612
But at at least you know that the
capability arises, and maybe you can tell

120
00:07:22.612 --> 00:07:26.850
a friend that actually is using that,
and be able to pass along the knowledge.

121
00:07:26.850 --> 00:07:29.870
And of course, as always,
we like to have some fun.

122
00:07:29.870 --> 00:07:33.530
Hopefully by learning these concepts and

123
00:07:33.530 --> 00:07:38.720
you getting more familiar with them
will make Word a lot more fun for you.

124
00:07:38.720 --> 00:07:43.216
I hope you have fun enjoying these
episodes, and I will see you soon.

125
00:07:43.216 --> 00:07:48.429
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne demonstrate and explain using bookmarks and cross references. Here they show you bookmark specifics like marking a location, naming conventions, and selecting a range of content. Then they look at cross reference specifics like using hyperlinks and choosing what text to display as the cross reference.
episodes.title: Bookmarks and Cross References

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne show you how to insert a table of contents (TOC) into your Word documents. Here they will go over heading levels (styles), TOC templates, map to custom styles for TOC, updating TOC, and removing TOC.
episodes.title: Table of Contents

episodes.description: Vonne and Daniel show how to manually mark words and ranges to be included in an index and then how generate the index. They also cover how to auto mark entries from a concordance file, how to update and format an index, and how to remove marked entries.
episodes.title: Index

episodes.description: Citing work for use in research or academic papers is very important. In this episode, Vonne and Ronnie show you how easy Word has made it to add and manage sources, insert citations, and generate and update a bibliography.
episodes.title: Citations and Bibliography

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne discuss footnotes and endnotes. They cover how to add, format, update, delete, and convert footnotes and/or endnotes in a Word document.
episodes.title: Footnotes and Endnotes

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Ronnie demonstrate adding captions to graphical elements. They cover how to create custom labels, how to insert or delete captions that should automatically update (and how to force them to update when it doesn’t auto update), and ultimately generate a table of figures.
episodes.title: Captions and Table of Figures

episodes.description: Vonne and Ronnie demonstrate how to create a master document and use the Outlining tab on the Ribbon. They show how to add, collapse and expand, and unlink subdocuments. They also discuss the importance of using consistent headings.
episodes.title: Master Document

episodes.description: Vonne and Ronnie discuss some of the issues one might encounter when using master documents.  They demonstrate issues with mismatched styles, common warning prompts, and linking issues.
episodes.title: Master Document Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne show you how to track changes made to documents in Word 2016 for Mac. Here you will specifically learn how to enable/disable tracking, add comments, make changes, and how to modify display preferences. They demonstrate how to review tracked changes by accepting or rejecting changes as well as deleting comments. They also show how to lock tracking so collaborators cannot turn them off.
episodes.title: Track Changes

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne take a look at two separate, yet related functions – compare documents and combine documents. First, they explore using compare documents which allows you to merge two documents together and Word highlights the differences. Next, they show you how to combine tracked edits from multiple documents into a single document.
episodes.title: Compare and Combine Documents

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne show you how to collaborate with others to make edits in your documents using OneDrive and other Office 365 account features. They will explain how to invite collaborators, chat in real time, and remove sharing in OneDrive when necessary. They demonstrate using both locally installed Word and Word Online.
episodes.title: Collaborate Online

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne go over some important security features found in Word for Mac. Specific features you'll see here includes, hidden text, restrict editing, and adding password protection to a document. They also discuss the differences between options offered in Word for Mac versus Word for Windows.
episodes.title: Document Security

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate working with document properties which will help make a document more searchable as well as adding more usable information to a document. This is also known as metadata. They also discuss the importance of checking for accessibility in documents.
episodes.title: Document Properties and Accessibility

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne show you how to customize the Word User Interface(UI) to suit your personal tastes. Specific customizations covered here includes: customizing the Ribbon, custom keyboard shortcuts, and review key options in the Word preferences.
episodes.title: Customize Interface

episodes.description: Justin and Vonne demonstrate how to create fillable forms in Word for Mac.  They show how to insert text fields, checkboxes, and dropdown menus. They also discuss the importance of the protect forms command to allow users to use to form.
episodes.title: Forms
